title: Update Mixpanel tracking snippet with provided project token

requirements.text: Update the Mixpanel tracking snippet in frontend/index.html to use the exact script content provided by the user, including calling mixpanel.init('da58e366649ab3a9c5b1fc49681f9d76', { autocapture: true, record_sessions_percent: 100, }) and keeping the snippet placed inside the <head> (right before the closing </head> tag).
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html contains exactly one Mixpanel snippet in the <head>.
The Mixpanel snippet includes mixpanel.init('da58e366649ab3a9c5b1fc49681f9d76', { autocapture: true, record_sessions_percent: 100, }) (i.e., the placeholder token 'YOUR_PROJECT_TOKEN' is replaced).
The Mixpanel snippet remains loaded globally for the entire app (i.e., included in frontend/index.html, not per-route).
The app builds and loads without console errors caused by the Mixpanel snippet.

constraints: Do not edit files in frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not edit immutable hook/bootstrap paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Keep the existing Google Analytics, Microsoft Clarity (tag vc3rnks6lt), Contentsquare, and Smartlook snippets intact and present in frontend/index.html.
nonGoals: Adding new Mixpanel event tracking calls in React code (beyond the provided autocapture/session recording settings).
Adding or changing any other analytics provider configuration besides the Mixpanel snippet/token update.
